intro: Garnotia acutigluma f. abbreviata, commonly known as the short-leaved garnotia, is a botanical variant characterized by its compact growth habit and reduced foliage. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, known for its aromatic compounds and often compound umbels of flowers. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are shorter and more densely packed than those of the typical species. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clustered inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This form is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and adaptability to various garden conditions.
